repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
**Problem**: `uv_dlclose` clears `lib->errmsg`, so `uv_dlerror` always returns `no error`
https://github.com/libuv/libuv/blob/e59e2a9e49c96feffebdfd44915320e32a91a957/src/unix/dl.c#L41

**Solution**: get error message before closing

comment_data.body: This is unreachable now as `luaL_error` causes a long jump in C.

We can't store `const char *` returned by `uv_dlerror`, it is not a static storage and can be freed after dlclose.
`strdup` does not work either for it may cause memory leak :exploding_head:
Why can't we use a stack allocated string?

"128 chars; that ought to be enough for anyone"

(Can use `IOSIZE`; there's also `ERR_BUFLEN` (80).)

> "128 chars; that ought to be enough for anyone"

In fact I just wrote `char [128]`, then I found something like
```
/usr/lib/libtree-sitter-markdown.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
```
took up almost 100 chars :rofl:
Wait till you meet its brother, `libtree-sitter-markdown-inline.so`
Give it 1MB for all I care. Errors are allowed to be slow.

can't we use `IObuff`?
```suggestion
    xstrlcpy(IObuff, uv_dlerror(&lib), sizeof(IObuff));
```

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(treesitter): uv_dlclose after uv_dlerror
